hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric ETF Flow Catalyst in Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, negative BTC price catalysts will trigger disproportionately large outflows from US spot Bitcoin ETFs (>2x the typical outflow per percent price drop), creating a self-reinforcing loop that amplifies downside moves over a 3-5 day period.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress regimes, traditional finance investors (ETF holders) exhibit panic selling and momentum-following behavior. Large outflows force ETF issuers to sell BTC, creating additional selling pressure that exceeds the initial catalyst impact.
entry_conditions: Negative catalyst hits (price drop >3% in 24 hours)
First day of ETF outflows exceeds $250M
BTC dominance decreases as altcoins sell off more (capitulation signal)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3 consecutive days of declining ETF outflows OR total outflow >$1B
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETF flows turn net positive on any day after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETF outflow multiplier < 1.5x during stress regimes OR no correlation between outflow size and subsequent price decline.
